statements: SELECT * FROM communication_logs;
SELECT log_id, timestamp, sender, recipient, message FROM communication_logs;
SELECT timestamp, sender, recipient FROM communication_logs WHERE log_id = 1;
SELECT sender, message FROM communication_logs WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01 00:00:00';
SELECT * FROM communication_logs ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT sender, recipient, message, timestamp FROM communication_logs WHERE log_id = 1;
SELECT log_id, message FROM communication_logs WHERE sender = 'Alice' ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT * FROM communication_logs WHERE recipient = 'Bob' AND timestamp BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-02-01';
SELECT sender, COUNT(*) AS total_messages FROM communication_logs GROUP BY sender HAVING total_messages > 2 ORDER BY total_messages DESC;
SELECT DISTINCT sender FROM communication_logs WHERE message LIKE '%important%';
SELECT * FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE log_id = 1;
SELECT sender_name, recipient_name, timestamp FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE timestamp < '2021-10-01';
SELECT DISTINCT sender_name, recipient_name FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE sender_name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT * FROM CommunicationLogs ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT user_id, full_name, role FROM Users WHERE role = 'Admin';
SELECT full_name, phone_number, email FROM Users WHERE role = 'admin';
SELECT * FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE sender_name = 'John Doe' ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT user_id, full_name, role FROM Users WHERE role IN ('admin', 'manager') AND email LIKE '%@example.com';
SELECT sender_name, recipient_name, timestamp FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE timestamp >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY timestamp ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT user_id, full_name, email, phone_number FROM Users ORDER BY full_name ASC, user_id DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM communication_logs ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT message, communication_type FROM communication_logs WHERE sender_id = 1 AND receiver_id = 2;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM teachers WHERE department = 'Science';
SELECT * FROM parents WHERE phone_number LIKE '%1234%';
SELECT sender_id, receiver_id, COUNT(*) AS message_count FROM communication_logs GROUP BY sender_id, receiver_id ORDER BY message_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM communication_logs WHERE communication_type = 'email' ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT message, sender_id, receiver_id FROM communication_logs WHERE sender_id = 1001 AND receiver_id = 2002;
SELECT first_name, last_name, email FROM teachers WHERE department = 'Math' ORDER BY first_name ASC;
SELECT parent_id, first_name, email, phone_number FROM parents WHERE phone_number LIKE '%123%' ORDER BY parent_id;
SELECT * FROM communication_logs WHERE timestamp BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31' AND communication_type = 'sms' ORDER BY log_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM Teachers;
SELECT name, email FROM Parents WHERE parent_id = 5;
SELECT log_id, sender_id, receiver_id, staff_id, timestamp FROM CommunicationLogs WHERE staff_id = 3;
SELECT name, role FROM SupportStaff ORDER BY role DESC;
SELECT teacher_id, name, email FROM Teachers WHERE name LIKE 'S%' ORDER BY teacher_id ASC;
SELECT * FROM Teachers;
SELECT name, email FROM Parents ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT staff_id, role FROM SupportStaff WHERE role = 'Administrator';
SELECT CONCAT('From: ', t.name, ' | To: ', p.name) AS communication_log FROM CommunicationLogs cl JOIN Teachers t ON cl.sender_id = t.teacher_id JOIN Parents p ON cl.receiver_id = p.parent_id;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_logs, DATE(timestamp) AS log_date FROM CommunicationLogs GROUP BY DATE(timestamp) ORDER BY log_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM communication_logs;
SELECT log_description, log_type FROM communication_logs ORDER BY log_timestamp DESC;
SELECT teacher_name, teacher_email FROM teachers WHERE teacher_id = 3;
SELECT parent_name FROM parents WHERE parent_email LIKE '%gmail.com%';
SELECT staff_name FROM support_staff ORDER BY staff_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM communication_logs ORDER BY log_timestamp DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT log_description, log_timestamp FROM communication_logs WHERE log_type = 'Alert' ORDER BY log_timestamp ASC;

SELECT c.communication_id, c.log_id, cl.log_description, c.communication_datetime, SS.staff_name FROM communications c INNER JOIN communication_logs cl ON c.log_id = cl.log_id INNER JOIN support_staff SS ON SS.staff_id = c.sender_id WHERE c.receiver_id = 1;

SELECT t.teacher_name, p.parent_name, cl.log_description FROM communication_logs cl INNER JOIN teachers t ON cl.teacher_id = t.teacher_id INNER JOIN parents p ON cl.parent_id = p.parent_id WHERE cl.log_type = 'Reminder';

SELECT DISTINCT cl.log_type, count(c.communication_id) AS total_communications FROM communication_logs cl LEFT JOIN communications c ON cl.log_id = c.log_id GROUP BY cl.log_type ORDER BY total_communications DESC;
